name: HL7EuImagingStudyReport
title: HL7 Europe Imaging Study Report
description: This guide describes how a Imaging Study Report can be represented in the European REALM.
copyright: Used by permission of HL7 Europe, all rights reserved Creative Commons License

grouping.name: eHN Imaging Studies and Reports Guidelines (informative)
grouping.description: Logical models  representing the eHN Imaging Studies and Reports Guidelines. This is informative material.

grouping.name: Data Entry Points
grouping.description: The key resources representing the entry points for imaging study reports.

resource.name: A Medical Imaging Report (eHN)
resource.description: Medical Imaging Report

resource.name: A.1 Report header data elements (eHN)
resource.description: A.1 Report header data elements (eHN)

resource.name: A.1.1 Identification of the patient/subject
resource.description: Identification of the patient/subject

resource.name: A.1.2 Patient/subject related contact information
resource.description: Patient/subject related contact information

resource.name: A.1.3 Health insurance and payment information
resource.description:
Health insurance information is not always required, 
however, in some jurisdictions, the insurance number is also 
used as the patient identifier. It is necessary not just for 
identification but also forms access to funding for care.

resource.name: A.1.4 Information recipient
resource.description: Intended recipient or recipients of the report, e.g., GP, another specialist. Multiple recipients could be provided.

resource.name: A.1.5 Author
resource.description: Author (by whom the imaging report or a subset of its results was authored). Multiple authors could be provided.

resource.name: A.1.6 Legal authenticator
resource.description: The person taking responsibility for the medical content of the document.

resource.name: A.1.7 Result validator
resource.description: Result validator

resource.name: A.1.8 Document metadata
resource.description: Document metadata

resource.name: A.2 Order information
resource.description: Note: an imaging report could respond to multiple orders.

resource.name: A.3 Order Reason
resource.description: Note: an imaging report could respond to multiple reasons.

resource.name: A.4 Specimen information
resource.description: Note: a specimen (not attached to a body) can be used for diagnostic, forensic and medical research purposes.

resource.name: A.5 Examination Report
resource.description: Examination Report

resource.name: A.5.1 Imaging procedure description
resource.description: Note: this part records the technical details of the performed procedures and may include information about protocol, imaging phases, imaging device, anatomical location, performer, place, date and time of performance.

resource.name: A.5.2 Medication
resource.description: Medication section includes information about medication administered during the medical imaging examination (contrast, sedation, stress agents), etc.

resource.name: A.5.3 Adverse reaction
resource.description: Adverse reactions manifested during imaging investigation.

resource.name: A.5.4 Results
resource.description: Note: The results summarise the findings and observations by the health professional following the imaging study. Note: this part includes textual as well as structured results or findings of the imaging investigation.

resource.name: A.5.5 Conclusion
resource.description: A concise and clinically contextualised summary including interpretation/impression of the diagnostic report

resource.name: A.5.6 Recommendation
resource.description: Recommendation

resource.name: A.6 Key images associated with this report
resource.description: Key images associated with this report

resource.name: A.7 Comparison study
resource.description: Comparison study

resource.name: A.8 Presented form
resource.description: Presented form

resource.name: Adverse Event
resource.description: Adverse event during imaging procedure.

resource.name: Allergic Reaction
resource.description: This profile represents a suspected allergic reaction occurred during or due to an imaging study procedure.

resource.name: B Imaging study manifest data set (eHN)
resource.description:
The data set defines the contents of the key information about the imaging study as conveyed by the imaging study manifest data set. 
The imaging study manifest contains key information about the imaging study that is referenced, including the “pointers” that allow 
access to the series of images.
It is important to note that the metadata used in expressing the filters associated with the querying for a list of imaging studies and/or 
imaging reports are defined in Section 2 Article 10: Selection List and filtering Parameters. These parameters are expressed as coded 
values from standardised value sets to ensure a robust search for a list of relevant imaging studies. Such metadata filtering parameters 
are associated with imaging studies, but may not be present in the content of the imaging study manifest.

resource.name: Bundle: Imaging Study Report
resource.description: Clinical document used to represent a Imaging Study Report for the scope of the HL7 Europe project.

resource.name: CodeSystem for terminology for Endpoint resources used in the EU Imaging IG.
resource.description: This code system defines various codes used to define ValueSets for Endpoints within the HL7-EU imaging IG.

resource.name: Coverage information
resource.description: Health Insurance and Payment Information. This resource represents the insurance coverage for a patient.

resource.name: Diagnostic Report Support Info Code System
resource.description: Code system for codes to be used in `DiagnosticReport.supportInfo` for imaging reports.

resource.name: DiagnosticReport supportInfo codes
resource.description: Codes to be used in `DiagnosticReport.supportInfo` for imaging reports.

resource.name: Document DiagnosticReport Reference
resource.description: This extension provides a reference to the DiagnosticReport instance that is associated with this Composition.

resource.name: Finding
resource.description: Finding during imaging procedure.

resource.name: Health Insurance Provider
resource.description:
Health Insurance Provider profile for healthcare organizations, this resource contains all information
related to a health insurance provider.

resource.name: Imaging Accession Number Identifier
resource.description: This profile on Identifier represents the Accession Number for the Imaging Order.

resource.name: Imaging Accession Number Reference
resource.description: This profile on Reference represents a reference to an Imaging Order.

resource.name: Imaging Adverse Event Criticality
resource.description: Replicates AllergyIntolerance.criticality to introduce functionality in AdverseEvent resource.

resource.name: Imaging Authoring Device
resource.description: This profile represents the device used to author the Imaging Diagnostic Report.

resource.name: Imaging Composition
resource.description: Clinical document used to represent a Imaging Study Report for the scope of the HL7 Europe project.

resource.name: Imaging Device
resource.description: This profile on Device represents the imaging device.

resource.name: Imaging Diagnostic Report
resource.description: Diagnostic Report profile for Imaging Reports. This document represents the report of an imaging study. It is the anchor resource that refers to all structured data as well as the `Composition` resource that contains the narrative text of the report.

resource.name: Imaging Key Image Document Reference
resource.description:
A document containing key images for a patient. It can refer to a DICOM or non-DICOM image. When referring to a DICOM image, the DocumentReference.content.attachment.url should be a WADO-URI. When referring to a non-DICOM image, the DocumentReference.content.attachment.url should be a direct URL to the image.

When the resource represents a DICOM instance it SHALL contain a the SOP Instance UID in the identifier element. When the resource represents a DICOM series it SHALL contain the Series Instance UID in the identifier element.

resource.name: Imaging Order
resource.description: This profile on ServiceRequest represents the order for the Imaging Study and report.

resource.name: Imaging Patient
resource.description: Human patient representing the subject of a medical imaging study for the scope of the HL7 Europe project.

resource.name: Imaging Procedure
resource.description: This profile on Procedure represents the imaging procedure.

resource.name: Imaging Report Types
resource.description:
Imaging Report Types.
This version includes only one code as suggested by the eHN guideline.
To add specificity the https://loinc.org/kb/users-guide/loinc-rsna-radiology-playbook-user-guide/ could be incorporated as the source of imaging study/report types.

resource.name: Imaging results from Procedure Phase
resource.description:
Represents the part of an imaging study that relates to a procedure phase such as e.g., without contrast, arterial phase, venous 
phase, delayed phase. Only some types of studies have phases.

resource.name: Imaging study performer
resource.description: The healtcare professional who performed the study/procedure.

resource.name: Imaging Study Reports Producer
resource.description: Producer profile for this IG

resource.name: ImagingStudy
resource.description: This profile represents an imaging study instance.

resource.name: Impression
resource.description: Impression of the imaging study. A conclusion drawn by the author based on the findings of the study.

resource.name: Information Recipient
resource.description: Information recipient (intended recipient or recipients of the report, e.g., GP, another specialist).

resource.name: Key images represented as an ImagingSelection
Legal Authenticator
resource.description: Legal authenticator (The person taking responsibility for the medical content of the document).

resource.name: Mapping of A.1.1 Identification of the patient/subject
resource.description: This concept map defines the mapping between the A.1.1 Identification of the patient/subject section and the FHIR profiles.

resource.name: Mapping of A.1.2 Patient/subject related contact information
resource.description: This concept map defines the mapping between the A.1.2 Patient/subject related contact information section and the FHIR profiles.

resource.name: Mapping of A.1.3 Health Insurance and Payment Information
resource.description: This concept map defines the mapping between the A.1.3. Health Insurance and Payment Information section and the FHIR profiles.

resource.name: Mapping of A.1.4 Information Recipient
resource.description: This concept map defines the mapping between the A.1.4 Information Recipient section and the FHIR profiles.

resource.name: Mapping of A.1.5 Information Author
resource.description: This concept map defines the mapping between the A.1.5 Information Author section and the FHIR profiles.

resource.name: Mapping of A.1.6 Legal Authenticator
resource.description: This concept map defines the mapping between the A.1.6 Legal Authenticator section and the FHIR profiles.

resource.name: Mapping of A.1.7 Result Validator
resource.description: This concept map defines the mapping between the A.1.7 Result Validator section and the FHIR profiles.

resource.name: Mapping of A.1.8 Document Metadata
resource.description: This concept map defines the mapping between the A.1.8 Document Metadata section and the FHIR profiles.

resource.name: Mapping of A.2 Order Information to FHIR profiles
resource.description: This concept map defines the mapping between the A.2 Order Information section and the FHIR profiles.

resource.name: Mapping of A.3 Order Reason to FHIR profiles
resource.description: This concept map defines the mapping between the A.3 Order Reason section and the FHIR profiles.

resource.name: Mapping of A.4 Specimen
resource.description:
This concept map defines the mapping between the A.3 Order Reason section and the FHIR profiles.  

The Specimen relates to a different type of information stored in a PACS: digital pathology. This has to analysed in more detail before inclusion in the IG. One of the things that might be impacted is the structure of the report.

resource.name: Mapping of A.5.1 Imaging Procedure Description
resource.description: The procedure information is expected to be part of the `ImProcedure` profile and not on `ImagingStudy.procedure` as there is a large overlap in information that is to be presented.

resource.name: Mapping of A.5.2 Imaging Procedure Medication
resource.description: Maps on A.5.2-ImagingProcedureMedication section of the eHN Medical Imaging Report to the FHIR profiles.

resource.name: Mapping of A.5.3 Adverse reaction (Adverse reactions manifested during imaging investigation.
resource.description: Maps on A.5.2-ImagingProcedureMedication section of the eHN Medical Imaging Report to the FHIR profiles.

resource.name: Mapping of A.5.4 Results
resource.description: Maps the A.5.4 Results section of the eHN Medical Imaging Report to the FHIR profiles.

resource.name: Mapping of A.5.5 Conclusion
resource.description: Maps the A.5.5 Results section of the eHN Medical Imaging Report to the FHIR profiles.

resource.name: Mapping of A.5.6 Recommendation
resource.description: Maps the A.5.6 Results section of the eHN Medical Imaging Report to the FHIR profiles.

resource.name: Mapping of A.6 Key images associated with this report
resource.description: Maps the A.6 Key Images section of the eHN Medical Imaging Report to the FHIR profiles.

resource.name: Mapping of A.7 Comparison Study
resource.description: Maps the A.7 Key Images section of the eHN Medical Imaging Report to the FHIR profiles.

resource.name: Mapping of A.8 Presented Form
resource.description: Maps the A.8 Presented Form section of the eHN Medical Imaging Report to the FHIR profiles.

resource.name: Mapping of B Imaging study manifest data set
resource.description: Maps the B Imaging study manifest data set  section of the eHN Medical Imaging Report to the FHIR profiles.

resource.name: Medication
resource.description: Based on EPD Medication profile. Reference it once it is published.

resource.name: Medication Administration
resource.description: Record of medication administration during imaging procedure.

resource.name: Missing DICOM Terminology
resource.description: Code system for codes that are defined in DICOM but for which no matching code system is available in FHIR.

resource.name: Order Placer
resource.description: The healthcare professional who placed the order for the study.

resource.name: Organization
resource.description:
Organization profile for healthcare organizations, this resource contains all information
related to healthcare organizations.

resource.name: Practitioner
resource.description:
Practitioner profile for healthcare professionals, this resource contains all demographic information
releted to healthcare professionals.

resource.name: Practitioner Role
resource.description:
Practitioner Role profile for healthcare professionals, all references to healthcare professionals
will be of this type.

resource.name: Radiation Dose Observation
resource.description:
A record for the radiation dose the subject has been exposed to during an imaging procedure.

This resource is a placeholder pending further refinement in this topic.


E.g. based on information from https://dicom.nema.org/medical/dicom/current/output/html/part16.html.

resource.name: Radiation Dose Observation Unit ValueSet
resource.description: Units for Radiation Dose Observations.

resource.name: Recommended CarePlan
resource.description:
Recommended care plan for the patient based on the imaging study. 
Contains the narrative containing the plan including proposals, goals, and order requests for monitoring, tracking, or improving the condition of the patient. In the future it is expected that the care plan could be provided in a structured and coded format.

resource.name: Report Author
resource.description: Author (by whom the imaging report or a subset of its results was authored). Multiple authors could be provided.

resource.name: Represents the part of an imaging study.
Result Validator
resource.description:
Result validator. The healthcare professional who is responsible 
validating the diagnostic report.

resource.name: Viewer endpoint
resource.description:
This profile defines a placeholder for an Endpoint for a viewer that can be used to access the study, serie it is present on.
The application is based on [IHE-IID](https://www.ihe.net/uploadedFiles/Documents/Radiology/IHE_RAD_Suppl_IID.pdf).

resource.name: WADO endpoint
resource.description: This profile defines the WADO endpoint for accessing imaging study content.
